title: This laptop drives me crazy!! No way to boot from USB!

forumNotes.author: damlays
forumNotes.content:
I have sony vaio (vgn-a) laptop..I tried every possibility that I can with every way that I read from this forum and other sources..but no no and again no..I could never ever boot my laptop from usb.. I tried different usb sticks, I tried different partition quantities and formats, I tried different softwares like FlashBoot, Boot2Stick, HP Disk..Tool, I tried different boot systems like dor, freedor, windows boot images, BartPE, I even tried to connect my (XP - bootable) 5'25 inch harddisk (from my Desktop computer) via usb (with the help of usb harddisk box) but the result was same = NO It is turned into a fight between my computer and me..it drives me crazy..PLEASE HELP! Where is the mistake? My BIOS has an option in boot menu as "Removable". I am trying to switch my boot device both choosing it with using "ESC" at startup or making it the first place to boot in my BIOS settings. At the end I removed other boot options from BIOS and left only "boot from removable" BUT MY LAPTOP NEVER EVER SEEs USB AS BOOT PLACE. If it is not functional to boot from USB at this computer, then why did they but "Boot from Removable" option to BUOS. There must be something wrong. What should I do?
By the way, my laptop has internal Memory Stick reader, so I tried every thing for that memory stick also beside of USB sticks, no boot was available from any removable memory device.

forumNotes.author: ktp
forumNotes.content:
Did you try to develop in the BIOS the hard disk list (usually with a + sign)?. Then you should see you USB hard disk listed. Then you change the boot order priority to set the USB HDD on top of the list.  

Your case could be the same as in this thread:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=5684](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=5684 "External link")

forumNotes.author: ktp
forumNotes.content:
OK I have AMI BIOS with one laptop, and there is a BIOS option : Legacy USB support. This has to be activated (even if you do not use legacy USB mouse, keyboard) in order that USB HDD to be recognized. So make sure that it is well enabled.  

Edit: after some Google search, it seems effectively that VAIO notebooks cannot boot USB HDD! This is not acceptable!  
If this is true, then you have to use the PLoP bootmanager, boot PLoP from a CD first.  
[http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanager.html](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanager.html "External link")  
[http://www.plop.at/e...tmanagerdl.html](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanagerdl.html "External link")

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> By the way, I can share some other findings from my trials with Plop CD:  
> I was tesing with three sticks 1)4GB Sandisk, 2) 250MB Usb Stick 3)SD Card in a USB SD Card Reader  
> Only number 1)4GB Sandisk (usb stick) is working. Number 2 cannot be seen in anyway   
> And with number 3 only "card reader" can be seen but SD card cannot be seen; it waits with a messafe "looking for boot sector.." like that  
>
> thanks for help..

Most probably items #2 and #3 have not been formatted properly, i.e. they are "super-floppies" instead of "HD-like", or however have improper partitioning data.  

Search on the board for posts by me "jaclaz" with keyword "hdhacker", to get the hang of it, then post the MBR and bootsectors of the media that do not work, and I'll have a look at it.  

In some cases (the card reader) it may be a hardware problem ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png), but it should be well possible to make the 250 Mb stick bootable.  

jaclaz
